prompt:

    1. First, identify consistent patterns in ratings and sentiments
    2. Next, observe common themes across product purposes and use cases
    3. Then, note recurring quality preferences and price sensitivity patterns
    4. Finally, synthesize these observations into core preferences

    Remember to:

    - Avoid repeating specific product names or details

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analysis of the purchase history reveals a strong preference for hydrating sheet masks, particularly those containing retinol, collagen, and complementary ingredients like rose water and hyaluronic acid. The consumer consistently seeks products that promise moisturizing benefits and anti-aging effects, often emphasizing hydration post-exposure to the sun or for rejuvenation after stressful days. 

Ratings indicate a higher satisfaction with products that not only deliver on hydration but also provide a pleasant scent experience and ease of use. Positive sentiment is frequently noted in relation to the relaxation effects of scented masks, suggesting an inclination towards sensory enhancement.

In terms of quality preferences, the consumer appears to favor spa-quality products that balance effectiveness with sensory appeal. They exhibit moderate price sensitivity, as evidenced by the high rating of some wholesale options, indicating value-consciousness without compromising on product performance. 

Overall, the core preferences can be synthesized as a focus on hydrating, effective skincare solutions that enhance relaxation and rejuvenation, with a moderate vigilance towards quality and pricing.

target_interaction.title: Wonderful!
target_interaction.text: These masks might be my favorite.  The masks themselves worked wonders, but I think it was the green tea that really did the trick!
target_interaction.title_meta: Hydrogel Face Masks (5 MASKS) with Aloe, Matcha Green Tea, & Caffeine; WHOLESALE Gel Sheet Masks for Anti-Aging, Deep Hydration - Collagen and Antioxidants Repair Sun Damage, Brighten Skin
